013package org.apache.juneau.svl;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArgUtils.*;
016import java.io.*;
017
018/**
019 * Abstract superclass of all Simple Var Language variables.
020 *
021 * <p>
022 * Vars are used to convert simple variables of the form <js>"$varName{varKey}"</js> into something else by the
023 * {@link VarResolver} class.
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * Subclasses must implement one of the following two methods:
027 * <ul class='javatree'>
028 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #resolve(VarResolverSession,String)} - For simple vars.
029 *    <li class='jm'>{@link #resolveTo(VarResolverSession,Writer,String)} - For streamed vars.
030 * </ul>
031 *
032 * <p>
033 * Subclasses MUST implement a no-arg constructor so that class names can be passed to the
034 * {@link VarResolver.Builder#vars(Class...)} method.
035 * <br><b>They must also be thread safe!</b>
036 *
037 * <p>
038 * Two direct abstract subclasses are provided to differentiated between simple and streamed vars:
039 * <ul class='javatree'>
040 *    <li class='jac'>{@link SimpleVar}
041 *    <li class='jac'>{@link StreamedVar}
042 * </ul>
043 *
044 * <ul class='seealso'>
045 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../overview-summary.html#juneau-marshall.jm.SimpleVariableLanguage">Simple Variable Language</a>
046
047 * </ul>
048 */
049public abstract class Var {
050
051   private final String name;
052   final boolean streamed;
053
054   /**
055    * Constructor.
056    *
057    * @param name The name of this variable.
058    * @param streamed
059    *    Whether this variable is 'streamed', meaning the {@link #resolveTo(VarResolverSession, Writer, String)} method
060    *    is implemented.
061    *    If <jk>false</jk>, then the {@link #resolve(VarResolverSession, String)} method is implemented.
062    */
063   public Var(String name, boolean streamed) {
064      assertArgNotNull("name", name);
065      this.name = name;
066      this.streamed = streamed;
067
068      for (int i = 0; i < name.length(); i++) {
069         // Need to make sure only ASCII characters are used.
070         char c = name.charAt(i);
071         if (c < 'A' || c > 'z' || (c > 'Z' && c < 'a'))
072            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid var name.  Must consist of only uppercase and lowercase ASCII letters.");
073      }
074   }
075
076   /**
077    * Return the name of this variable.
078    *
079    * <p>
080    * For example, the system property variable returns <js>"S"</js> since the format of the variable is
081    * <js>"$S{system.property}"</js>.
082    *
083    * @return The name of this variable.
084    */
085   protected String getName() {
086      return name;
087   }
088
089   /**
090    * Returns whether nested variables are supported by this variable.
091    *
092    * <p>
093    * For example, in <js>"$X{$Y{xxx}}"</js>, $Y is a nested variable that will be resolved if this method returns
094    * <jk>true</jk>.
095    *
096    * <p>
097    * The default implementation of this method always returns <jk>true</jk>.
098    * Subclasses can override this method to override the default behavior.
099    *
100    * @return <jk>true</jk> if nested variables are supported by this variable.
101    */
102   protected boolean allowNested() {
103      return true;
104   }
105
106   /**
107    * Returns whether variables in the resolved contents of this variable should also be resolved.
108    *
109    * <p>
110    * For example, if <js>"$X{xxx}"</js> resolves to <js>"$Y{xxx}"</js>, then the $Y variable will be recursively
111    * resolved if this method returns <jk>true</jk>.
112    *
113    * <p>
114    * The default implementation of this method always returns <jk>true</jk>.
115    * <br>Subclasses can override this method to override the default behavior.
116    *
117    * <div class='warn'>
118    * As a general rule, variables that resolve user-entered data should not be recursively resolved as this may
119    * cause a security hole.
120    * </div>
121    *
122    * @return <jk>true</jk> if resolved variables should be recursively resolved.
123    */
124   protected boolean allowRecurse() {
125      return true;
126   }
127
128   /**
129    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this variable can be resolved in the specified session.
130    *
131    * <p>
132    * For example, some variable cannot resolve unless specific context or session objects are available.
133    *
134    * @param session The current session.
135    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this variable can be resolved in the specified session.
136    */
137   protected boolean canResolve(VarResolverSession session) {
138      return true;
139   }
140
141   /**
142    * The method called from {@link VarResolver}.
143    *
144    * <p>
145    * Can be overridden to intercept the request and do special handling.
146    * <br>Default implementation simply calls resolve(String).
147    *
148    * @param session The session object used for a single instance of a string resolution.
149    * @param arg The inside argument of the variable.
150    * @return The resolved value.
151    * @throws Exception Any exception can be thrown.
152    */
153   protected String doResolve(VarResolverSession session, String arg) throws Exception {
154      return resolve(session, arg);
155   }
156
157   /**
158    * The interface that needs to be implemented for subclasses of {@link SimpleVar}.
159    *
160    * @param session The session object used for a single instance of a var resolution.
161    * @param arg The inside argument of the variable.
162    * @return The resolved value.
163    * @throws Exception Any exception can be thrown.
164    */
165   public abstract String resolve(VarResolverSession session, String arg) throws Exception;
166
167   /**
168    * The interface that needs to be implemented for subclasses of {@link StreamedVar}.
169    *
170    * @param session The session object used for a single instance of a var resolution.
171    * @param w The writer to send the resolved value to.
172    * @param arg The inside argument of the variable.
173    * @throws Exception Any exception can be thrown.
174    */
175   public abstract void resolveTo(VarResolverSession session, Writer w, String arg) throws Exception;
176}
